markdownText.html:
Sample Text 1

Bootle has rural service centre status, identified by the Lake District National Park planning authority. This status demonstrates the potential Bootle has for growth in population, services and prosperity.

The village has several key opportunities to allow this growth. It’s location is supported by the close proximity to many large, continually developing industries which have a total predicted growth and investment of £90 billion over the next five years, these include:

  • Sellafield, Seascale (the largest nuclear site in Europe)
  • Nugen Nuclear Project, Moorside
  • GSK Biopharmaceutical manufacturing facility, Ulverston
  • BAE Systems, Barrow
  • Siemens Subsea Business, Ulverston
  • West Lakes Science and Technology Park, Moor Row
  • Energy Opportunities Supply Chain Project, Britain’s Energy Coast and WCDA

As well as being strategically placed Bootle also has well connected infrastructure to support this development, most significantly the Carlisle to Lancaster Cumbrian coastal railway, the main West Cumbria highway, the A595 and the Sustrans National Cycle Network Route 72.

  1. Courtesy of www.sellafieldsite.co.uk
  2. Courtesy of Sustrans National Cycle Network
  3. Courtesy of Lake District National Park
